page.title: 11 The village hall,Polstead.
page.content: The present village hall was built in 1975 replacing a wooden ex-army hut from the 1914-18 war.The old hut was owned by the Women's Institute which was formed in 1919 but,in later years,the hut became too expensive for the W.I. to maintain.A village committee was formed and fund raising began.The present Hall cost fifteen thousand pounds to build.The hall is a centre for village activities,from the Playgroup to the Over-Sixties club,and is also used regularly for many fund-raising groups.The size of the Hall and the sprung wooden floor make it attractive for dances and discos.Musical evenings,Antiques fairs, Whist Drives,and Bazaars all take place in the Village Hall.The village school uses the hall for school meals and physical activities every day
